intro: Parietaria mauritanica var. latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf wall-rocket, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. Native to North Africa and the Canary Islands, this plant thrives in rocky and coastal environments. The leaves are often covered in fine hairs, and the plant is known for its ability to tolerate saline and arid conditions. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and resilience.
